page.title: 11Architecture in the area
page.content: The buildings in the survey are on the whole brick with relatively little new property being built in any of the villages.There are few council built houses in Shelton and Thoroton but most houses are privately owned though there a few tied cottages for farmworkers.Each village has some farmsteads and Shelton and Flawborough have large dwellings ie.halls.As there are no resident parsons there are no rectories.The main roofing material are red pantiles though the main exception is blue slate.Until recently there was 1 thatched roof at Flawborough but it is now part thatched.In Thoroton there is a dovecote of note it being a circular construction in stone.The only public meeting place is of wooden construction at Kilvington.
